content:
I just got this in a Reverse clash and at first thought it was way too hard just looking at it, it just seemed like too many things were happening at once and it was going to be too complex to code.

Then I just started working on it and realised it's all about taking rows as arrays of PAIRS of characters and then rotating those. Knowing rotation is just transposing rows to columns along with some reversal of the rows/columns makes it then very easy to actually solve this (especially in Ruby where ".transpose" is available).

In the end it only took a bit over 4 minutes. :) Nice clash. The test cases really help with understanding it, too. Unfortunately everyone else in my clash got 0% though (3/4, 2 of them were bots).

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Interesting clash,
working with pairs symbols

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Great Clash, might be a little hard when you dont know how to rotate the hands of the clock.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good clash.

Cases
* Pair 1 and Pair 4 are the same. Please revise Pair 4 (both test and validator) so that the pairs are different.

Stub generator
* Please add a write statement (e.g. "write answer").

Thanks.
Oops, meant to delete Pair 4 since I moved it to Pair 1. Did that and added "write answer". Thanks for the feedback!
